title: nf-core/raredisease pipeline parameters
description: call and score variants from WGS/WES of rare disease patients

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/raredisease/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

reference_file_options.title: Reference file options
reference_file_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

bait_padding.description: The amount to pad each end of the target intervals to create bait intervals.

bwa.help_text: If none provided, will be generated automatically from the FASTA reference.

bwamem2.help_text: If none provided, will be generated automatically from the FASTA reference.

bwameme.description: Directory for pre-built bwameme's learned index.
bwameme.help_text: If none provided, will be generated automatically from the FASTA reference.

cadd_resources.description: Path to the directory containing cadd annotations.
cadd_resources.help_text: This folder contains the uncompressed files that would otherwise be in data/annotation folder as described in https://github.com/kircherlab/CADD-scripts/#manual-installation.

fai.help_text: If none provided, will be generated automatically from the FASTA reference
fai.description: Path to FASTA genome index file.

fasta.help_text: This parameter is *mandatory* if `--genome` is not specified. If you don't have a BWA index available this will be generated for you automatically. Combine with `--save_reference` to save BWA index for future runs.

gcnvcaller_model.description: A file containing the path to models produced by GATK4 GermlineCNVCaller cohort.
gcnvcaller_model.help_text: This model is required for generating a cnv calls when using GermlineCNVCaller.

genome.help_text:
If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`. 

See the [nf-core website docs](https://nf-co.re/usage/reference_genomes) for more details.

gens_gnomad_pos.description: Path to a list of common SNP locations for Gens.
gens_gnomad_pos.help_text: Locations of gnomad SNPs with a high enough BAF.

gens_interval_list.description: Path to interval list for Gens.
gens_interval_list.help_text: This file contains the binning intervals used for CollectReadCounts.

gens_pon_female.description: Path to female panel of normals for Gens.
gens_pon_female.help_text: The female panel used to run DenoiseReadCounts.

gens_pon_male.description: Path to male panel of normals for Gens.
gens_pon_male.help_text: The male panel used to run DenoiseReadCounts.

gnomad_af.description: Path to the gnomad tab file with allele frequencies.
gnomad_af.help_text: Path to the gnomad tab file with CHR/START/REF,ALT/AF. Can be generated from the gnomad annotations vcf.

gnomad_af_idx.description: Path to the index file for the gnomad tab file with allele frequencies.
gnomad_af_idx.help_text: Path to the index of gnomad tab file with CHR/START/REF,ALT/AF

igenomes_base.description: The base path to the igenomes reference files

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

intervals_wgs.description: Path to the interval list of the genome (autosomes, sex chromosomes, and mitochondria).
intervals_wgs.help_text: Path to the interval list of the genome. This is used to calculate genome-wide coverage statistics.

intervals_y.description: Path to the interval list of the Y chromosome.
intervals_y.help_text: Path to the interval list of the Y chromosome. This is used to calculate coverage statistics for the Y chromosome.

known_dbsnp_tbi.description: Path to known dbSNP file index.

local_genomes.description: Local directory base for genome references that map to the config.
local_genomes.help_text: This folder is a flat structure with file names that map to the config.

mito_name.description: Name of the mitochondrial contig in the reference fasta file
mito_name.help_text: Used to extract relevant information from the references to analyse mitochondria

mobile_element_references.help_text:
Path to tsv file listing mobile element references. 
Format: <mobile element type>\t<path to bed file>

mobile_element_svdb_annotations.description: File with mobile element allele frequency references
mobile_element_svdb_annotations.help_text:
Path to csv file listing files containing mobile element allele frequencies in reference populations. 
Format: <vcf file path>,<in_freq_info_key>,<in_allele_count_info_key>,<out_freq_info_key>,<out_allele_count_info_key>

ml_model.description: Path to sentieon machine learning model file.

mt_fasta.description: Path to mitochondrial FASTA genome file.

par_bed.description: Path to a BED file containing PAR regions (used by deepvariant).

ploidy_model.description: Directory containing the ploidy model files
ploidy_model.help_text: Produced in GATK4 DetermineGermlineContigPloidy cohort, this model is required for generating a cnv model when using GermlineCNVCaller.

readcount_intervals.description: Interval list file containing the intervals over which read counts are tabulated for CNV calling
readcount_intervals.help_text: Generated by GATK4 preprocessintervals. It needs to be the same as the intervals used to generate the ploidy and cnv models.

reduced_penetrance.description: File with gene ids that have reduced penetrance. For use with genmod

rtg_truthvcfs.description: Vcf used for evaluating variant calls.
rtg_truthvcfs.help_text: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the truth vcf files used by vcfeval.

save_reference.description: If generated by the pipeline save the required indices/references in the results directory.
save_reference.help_text: The saved references can be used for future pipeline runs, reducing processing times.

score_config_mt.description: MT rank model config file for genmod.

score_config_snv.description: SNV rank model config file for genmod.

score_config_sv.description: SV rank model config file for genmod.

sdf.description: Directory for pre-built sdf index. Used by rtg/vcfeval
sdf.help_text: If none provided, will be generated automatically from the FASTA reference.

sequence_dictionary.description: Path to the genome dictionary file

svdb_query_bedpedbs.description: Databases used for structural variant annotation in chrA-posA-chrB-posB-type-count-frequency format.
svdb_query_bedpedbs.help_text: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the databases used for structural variant annotation.

svdb_query_dbs.description: Databases used for structural variant annotation in vcf format.
svdb_query_dbs.help_text: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the databases used for structural variant annotation.

target_bed.description: Path to directory for target bed file.
target_bed.help_text: If you would like to limit your analysis to specific regions of the genome, you can pass those regions in a bed file using this option

variant_catalog.help_text: Should be Stranger's extended JSON as described at https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/stranger/blob/master/stranger/resources/variant_catalog_grch37.json. This file is used by both ExpansionHunter and Stranger

sample_id_map.description: Path to a file containing internal ids and customer ids in csv format.
sample_id_map.help_text: Optional file to rename sample ids in the vcf2cytosure vcf

vcf2cytosure_blacklist.help_text: Optional file to blacklist regions for VCF2cytosure

vcfanno_extra_resources.description: Path to a VCF file containing annotations.
vcfanno_extra_resources.help_text: Can be used to supply case-specific annotations in addition to those provided using --vcfanno_resources

vcfanno_resources.description: Path to a file containing the absolute paths to resources defined within the vcfanno toml file. One line per resource.
vcfanno_resources.help_text: If no file is passed, default configurations will be used according to genome build within the context of the pipeline.

vcfanno_toml.description: Path to the vcfanno toml file.
vcfanno_toml.help_text: If no toml is passed, default configurations will be used according to genome build within the context of the pipeline.

vcfanno_lua.description: Path to the vcfanno lua file.
vcfanno_lua.help_text: Custom operations file (lua). For use when the built-in ops don't supply the needed reduction.

vep_cache.help_text: If no directory path is passed, vcf files will not be annotated by vep.

vep_plugin_files.description: Databases used by both named and custom plugins to annotate variants.
vep_plugin_files.help_text: Path to a file containing the absolute paths to databases and their indices used by VEP's custom and named plugins resources defined within the vcfanno toml file. One line per resource.

vep_filters.description: Path to the file containing HGNC_IDs of interest on separate lines.

vep_filters_scout_fmt.description: Path to a bed-like file exported by scout, which contains HGNC_IDs to be used in filter_vep.

analysis_options.title: Analysis options
analysis_options.description: Options used to steer the direction of the pipeline.

analysis_type.description: Specifies which analysis type for the pipeline- either 'wgs', 'wes' or 'mito'. This changes resources consumed and tools used.

bwa_as_fallback.description: Specifies whether or not to use bwa as a fallback aligner in case bwamem2 throws an error.
bwa_as_fallback.help_text: errorStrategy needs to be set to ignore for the bwamem2 process for the fallback to work. Turned off by default.

extract_alignments.description: After aligning the reads to a reference, extract alignments from specific regions/contigs and restrict the analysis to those regions/contigs.
extract_alignments.help_text: Set this to true, and specify the contig(s) using `restrict_to_contigs` parameter

platform.description: Specifies the platform on which the reads were sequenced.

restrict_to_contigs.description: Can be specified as RNAME[:STARTPOS[-ENDPOS]]. Multiple regions should be seperated by space

run_mt_for_wes.description: Specifies whether to run mitochondrial analysis for wes samples

run_rtgvcfeval.description: Specifies whether to run rtgtools' vcfeval

save_mapped_as_cram.description: Specifies whether to generate and publish alignment files as cram instead of bam

scatter_count.description: Number of intervals to split your genome into (used to parallelize annotations)

skip_fastp.description: Specifies whether or not to skip trimming with fastp.

skip_gens.description: Specifies whether or not to skip gens preprocessing subworkflow.

skip_germlinecnvcaller.description: Specifies whether or not to skip CNV calling using GATK's GermlineCNVCaller

skip_peddy.description: Specifies whether or not to skip peddy.

skip_me_calling.description: Specifies whether or not to skip calling mobile elements, and the subsequent annotation step.

skip_me_annotation.description: Specifies whether or not to skip annotation of mobile elements.

skip_mt_annotation.description: Specifies whether or not to skip annotation of mitochondrial variants.

skip_mt_subsample.description: Specifies whether or not to subsample mt alignment.

skip_repeat_annotation.description: Specifies whether or not to skip annotation of repeat expansions.

skip_repeat_calling.description: Specifies whether or not to skip calling of repeat expansions.

skip_smncopynumbercaller.description: Specifies whether or not to skip smncopynumbercaller.

skip_snv_annotation.description: Specifies whether or not to skip annotate SNV subworkflow.

skip_snv_calling.description: Specifies whether or not to skip nuclear and mitochondrial SNV calling and annotation.

skip_sv_annotation.description: Specifies whether or not to skip annotate structural variant subworkflow.

skip_sv_calling.description: Specifies whether or not to skip nuclear and mitochondrial SV calling and annotation.

skip_vcf2cytosure.description: Specifies whether or not to skip the vcf2cytosure subworkflow
skip_vcf2cytosure.help_text: vcf2cytosure can generate CGH files from a structural variant VCF file that can be analysed in the CytoSure interpretation software. Cut-offs for allele frequencies and bin sizes can be modified in the config file. Turned off by default.

skip_vep_filter.description: Specifies whether or not to filter results based on a list of candidate genes specified in 'vep_filters'.

alignment_options.title: Alignment options
alignment_options.description: Options to adjust parameters and filtering criteria for read alignments.

aligner.description: Specifies the alignment algorithm to use - available options are 'bwamem2', 'bwa', 'bwameme' and 'sentieon'.

mt_aligner.description: Specifies the alignment algorithm to use - available options are 'bwamem2', 'bwa' and 'sentieon'.

samtools_sort_threads.description: Number of threads allocated for sorting alignment files (used only by bwameme)
samtools_sort_threads.help_text: To know more about this parameter check [bwameme](https://github.com/kaist-ina/BWA-MEME?tab=readme-ov-file#building-pipeline-with-samtools) documentation.

mbuffer_mem.description: Memory allocated for mbuffer in megabytes (used only by bwameme)
mbuffer_mem.help_text: To know more about this parameter check [bwameme](https://github.com/kaist-ina/BWA-MEME?tab=readme-ov-file#building-pipeline-with-samtools) documentation.

min_trimmed_length.description: Discard trimmed reads shorter than the given value
min_trimmed_length.help_text: Minimum length of reads after adapter trimming. Shorter reads are discarded.

mt_subsample_rd.description: Expected coverage to subsample mt alignment to.
mt_subsample_rd.help_text: To know more about this parameter check [samtools' view](https://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools-view.html) documentation.

mt_subsample_seed.description: Subsampling seed used to influence which subset of mitochondrial reads is kept.
mt_subsample_seed.help_text: To know more about this parameter check [samtools' view](https://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools-view.html) documentation.

rmdup.description: Specifies whether duplicates reads should be removed prior to variant calling.

variant_calling_options.title: Variant calling options
variant_calling_options.description: Options to adjust parameters and filtering criteria for variant calling.

call_interval.description: Interval in the reference that will be used in the software. Used only by sentieon.

sentieon_dnascope_pcr_indel_model.description: Option for selecting the PCR indel model used by Sentieon Dnascope.
sentieon_dnascope_pcr_indel_model.help_text: PCR indel model used to weed out false positive indels more or less aggressively. The possible MODELs are: NONE (used for PCR free samples), and HOSTILE, AGGRESSIVE and CONSERVATIVE, in order of decreasing aggressiveness. The default value is CONSERVATIVE.

variant_caller.description: Specifies the variant caller to use - available options are 'deepvariant' and 'sentieon'.

variant_type.description: Specifies the variant types for sentieon variant caller.

annotation_options.title: Annotation options
annotation_options.description: Options used to facilitate the annotation of the variants.

variant_consequences_snv.description: File containing list of SO terms listed in the order of severity from most severe to lease severe for annotating genomic and mitochondrial SNVs.

variant_consequences_sv.description: File containing list of SO terms listed in the order of severity from most severe to lease severe for annotating genomic SVs.

vep_cache_version.description: Specify the version of the VEP cache provided to the `--vep_cache` option.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.
